page.title: 10CHURCHES IN SANDWICK
page.content: There are several churches in Sandwick. At Hoswick there is the Brethren hall. Visiting preachers preach there each week. At Stove there are 2 churches side by side. The Methodist church is the smaller of the two. There is a plaque on the outside which tells that it was built in 1828 and extended in 1893. Visiting preachers provide one service each Sunday. The United Free Church of Scotland is alongside the Methodist church. Two services are held each Sunday and the preacher is Mr Tom Ireland who lives in the manse nearby. The Church of Scotland is situated alongside the cemetery at Sandwick. It is the largest of the village churches. The Rev.E.McMillan is the minister.
